com.jakewharton.rxrelay

Class BehaviorRelay<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • rx.Observable<R>
      • com.jakewharton.rxrelay.Relay<T,T>
        • com.jakewharton.rxrelay.BehaviorRelay<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of item expected to be observed by the Relay
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    rx.functions.Action, rx.functions.Action1<T>, rx.functions.Function

    public class BehaviorRelay<T>
extends Relay<T,T>
    Relay that emits the most recent item it has observed and all subsequent observed items to each subscribed Observer.

    Example usage: 

     
 // observer will receive all events.
 BehaviorRelay<Object> relay = BehaviorRelay.create("default");
 relay.subscribe(observer);
 relay.call("one");
 relay.call("two");
 relay.call("three");

 // observer will receive the "one", "two" and "three" events, but not "zero"
 BehaviorRelay<Object> relay = BehaviorRelay.create("default");
 relay.call("zero");
 relay.call("one");
 relay.subscribe(observer);
 relay.call("two");
 relay.call("three");

    • Nested Class Summary

      • create

        public static <T> BehaviorRelay<T> create(T defaultValue)
        Creates a BehaviorRelay that emits the last item it observed and all subsequent items to each Observer that subscribes to it.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of item the Relay will emit
        Parameters:
        defaultValue - the item that will be emitted first to any Observer as long as the BehaviorRelay has not yet observed any items from its source Observable
        Returns:
        the constructed BehaviorRelay

        public boolean hasObservers()
        Description copied from class: Relay
        Indicates whether the Relay has Observers subscribed to it.
        Specified by:
        hasObservers in class Relay<T,T>
        Returns:
        true if there is at least one Observer subscribed to this Relay, false otherwise

      • hasValue

        @Beta
public boolean hasValue()
        Check if the Relay has a value.

        Use the getValue() method to retrieve such a value.

        Note that the value retrieved by getValue() may get outdated.

        Returns:
        true if and only if the relay has some value.

      • getValue

        @Beta
public T getValue()
        Returns the current value of the Relay if there is such a value.

        The method can return null for various reasons. Use hasValue() to determine if such null is a valid value.

        Returns:
        the current value or null if the Relay doesn't have a value, has terminated or has an actual null as a valid value.

      • getValues

        @Beta
public T[] getValues(T[] a)
        Returns a snapshot of the currently buffered events into the provided a array or creates a new array if it has not enough capacity.
        Parameters:
        a - the array to fill in
        Returns:
        the array a if it had enough capacity or a new array containing the available values

      • getValues

        @Beta
public Object[] getValues()
        Returns a snapshot of the currently buffered events.

        The operation is threadsafe.

        Returns:
        a snapshot of the currently buffered events.
        Since:
        (If this graduates from being an Experimental class method, replace this parenthetical with the release number)
